jpcap
Class IPAddress

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jpcap.IPAddress
public class IPAddress
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents an IP address.

Either IPv4 and IPv6 addresses can be represented by this class.

Constructor Summary
IPAddress(byte[] address)
          Creates IP address of the specified byte array.
This doesn't check if the address is valid.
IPAddress(int version, byte[] address)
          Creates IP address of the specified version and byte array.
This doesn't check if the address is valid.
IPAddress(int version, java.lang.String address)
          Creates an IP address of the specified version and IP address or domain name.
IPAddress(java.lang.String address)
          Creates IPv4 address of the specified address or domain name.
 
Method Summary
 boolean equals(java.lang.Object p)
          Check if this object is equal to the given object.
 byte[] getAddress()
          Returns the byte array of this object.
 java.lang.String getHostAddress()
          Returns the IP address string "%d.%d.%d.%d" or "%x:%x::%x:%x"
 java.lang.String getHostName()
          Return the domain name of this object.
 java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()
          Returns the instance of java.net.InetAddress, if this is IPv4 address.
Returns null if this is IPv6.
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns the IP address string "%d.%d.%d.%d" or "%x:%x::%x:%x"
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
